metadata.title: CVE-2024-53432 on Ubuntu 24.10 (oracular) - medium
metadata.description:
While parsing certain malformed PLY files, PCL version 1.14.1 crashes dueto an uncaught std::out_of_range exception in PCLPointCloud2::at. Thisissue could potentially be exploited to cause a denial-of-service (DoS)attack when processing untrusted PLY files.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2024-53432` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libpcl-apps1.14 - 1.14.0+dfsg-3ubuntu0.2
libpcl-common1.14 - 1.14.0+dfsg-3ubuntu0.2
libpcl-features1.14 - 1.14.0+dfsg-3ubuntu0.2
libpcl-filters1.14 - 1.14.0+dfsg-3ubuntu0.2
libpcl-io1.14 - 1.14.0+dfsg-3ubuntu0.2
libpcl-kdtree1.14 - 1.14.0+dfsg-3ubuntu0.2
libpcl-keypoints1.14 - 1.14.0+dfsg-3ubuntu0.2
libpcl-ml1.14 - 1.14.0+dfsg-3ubuntu0.2
libpcl-octree1.14 - 1.14.0+dfsg-3ubuntu0.2
libpcl-outofcore1.14 - 1.14.0+dfsg-3ubuntu0.2
libpcl-people1.14 - 1.14.0+dfsg-3ubuntu0.2
libpcl-recognition1.14 - 1.14.0+dfsg-3ubuntu0.2
libpcl-registration1.14 - 1.14.0+dfsg-3ubuntu0.2
libpcl-sample-consensus1.14 - 1.14.0+dfsg-3ubuntu0.2
libpcl-search1.14 - 1.14.0+dfsg-3ubuntu0.2
libpcl-segmentation1.14 - 1.14.0+dfsg-3ubuntu0.2
libpcl-stereo1.14 - 1.14.0+dfsg-3ubuntu0.2
libpcl-surface1.14 - 1.14.0+dfsg-3ubuntu0.2
libpcl-tracking1.14 - 1.14.0+dfsg-3ubuntu0.2
libpcl-visualization1.14 - 1.14.0+dfsg-3ubuntu0.2
pcl-tools - 1.14.0+dfsg-3ubuntu0.2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: pcl package in oracular was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.14.0+dfsg-3ubuntu0.2').
